title: Greek specialists back troubled destination
text:
Greek specialists back troubled destination 9 July 2015 Save 
Greek specialists are coming out in support of the destination as the country’s government seeks to reassure visitors that basic supplies will not run out. 
Following the country’s decision to vote no to the latest round of cuts proposed by the EU in return for funding on Sunday, the country’s future and economy remain on a knife edge. 
Already EU leaders are openly talking about Greece being thrown out of the single currency by the weekend. 
However, despite the potential for problems the trade is backing the destination with Planet Holidays adding a further eight islands to its 2016 programme. 
Managing director Mathilde Robert said the operator was also hoping to give the destination further exposure by moving it to the front of the operator’s brochure while new product is being featured in the most popular resorts. 
She added: “With the financial turmoil of the past years elevated this week, there is much in the media that may influence travellers from booking their next holiday to Greece. 
“However, while we watch the coverage on our TV or read about it at home, others are still enjoying this great country and we believe that Greece’s appeal will continue as it has done for centuries. We’re determined to show our support for this timeless, classic nation.” 
Meanwhile Aldemar Resorts vice president Alexandros Angelopoulos added: “Greece has been in the headlines for a great length of time, many might say for all the wrong reasons. One could also add that there have been a collection of assumptions and misconceptions. 
“As an independent hotel resort group, we can add that the importance of tourism for Greece has never waned during these difficult times. 
“The resilience and commitment by our trade partners in the UK and elsewhere has shown that Greece as a holiday destination is respected and loved for all the right reasons. 
“There are no misconceptions here, we still remain the country where our sun, sea and people come together in harmony and have done so for centuries, to provide visitors to our beautiful shores with timeless Greek Filoxenia. 
“We are also a holiday destination that continues to be attractive in pricing terms too. 
“It is a European country with an incomparable cultural, gastronomical and sentimental wealth, which enables us to say emphatically that we are here for the long haul and look forward to welcoming many more visitors until the end of October 2015, and for many more fruitful decades to come.”
